DOC.brief_summary: In study investigator aim investigate effect two different type non-invasive brain stimulation technique -- repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) transcranial direct current stimulation ( tDCS ) motor function stroke . This cross-over study subject receive 5 session stimulation ( separate 1 week ) -- either active tDCS sham rTMS , sham tDCS active rTMS sham tDCS rTMS .
DOC.brief_title: Effects rTMS tDCS Motor Function Stroke
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : ( 1 ) All subject must age 1890 . Exclusion criterion : 1 . History Major depression , define Beck Depression scale 30 ; 2 . Any substantial decrease alertness , language comprehension , attention might interfere understanding instruction motor testing ; 3 . Contraindications TMS history seizure unexplained loss consciousness metal head frequent severe headache neck pain implanted brain medical device . 4 . Contraindications tDCS metal head implant brain medical device 5 . Advanced liver , kidney , cardiac , pulmonary disease ; 6 . A terminal medical diagnosis consistent survival < 1 year ; 7 . Coexistent major neurological psychiatric disease ( decrease number confounders ) ; 8 . A history significant alcohol drug abuse prior 6 month ; 9 . Subjects may actively enrol separate intervention study target stroke recovery clinical trial ; 10 . Subjects global aphasia deficit comprehension 11 . Pregnancy . Female subject child bear potential asked take pregnancy test . If pregnancy test positive , subject may enroll study . 12 . Use neuropsychotropic medication [ healthy subject ] Additional inclusion criterion stroke subject : 1 . Firsttime clinical ischemic hemorrhagic cerebrovascular event evidence radiological ( physician 's ) report 2 . Weakness , define score less 55 ( 66 ) arm motor FuglMeyer ( FM ) scale 3 . Stroke onset > 6 month prior study enrollment . Additional exclusion criterion stroke subject : 1 . Subjects may already receive TMS and/or tDCS stimulation stroke ; 2 . History epilepsy stroke episode seizure within last six month ;
